newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-St George to establish insurance arm.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-St George to establish insurance arm.

text.p: St George Bank Ltd said on Thursday its St George Investment Services Ltd unit would apply for registration as a life insurance company.
The regional bank said earlier in 1996 that it was keen to establish an insurance arm and would consider external acquisitions or an internal start-up.
The bank said it would initially offer products covering life protection, term life, trauma and disability cover.
It said it did not plan to introduce general insurance products and these would continue to be provided through an agency agreement with the Sun Alliance Group.
Insurance operations should begin in the first half of 1997, St George said.
Managing director Jim Sweeney said the decision was "consistent with the bank's previously indicated intention to investigate opportunities to enter this market".
"By developing our own products we also protect the strength and integrity of the St George brand," Sweeney said.
"By starting our own insurance business, we can enter the market in areas where we have a distinct advantage without having to fund the purchase of a broader insurance operation," he said.
St George Bank shares were four cents lower at A$8.36 at 2.30 p.m. (0430 GMT).
